dcterms:creator: M. H. M. Winands
Y. Björnsson
J.-T. Saito
dcterms:description: Lines of Action (LOA) is played on an 8×8 board by two sides, Black and White. Each side has twelve pieces, and the goal is to connect all own pieces in one unit. The game involves moving pieces in straight lines based on the number of pieces along the line of movement.
dcterms:title: Lines of Action

dcterms:creator: M. J. Herskovits
dcterms:description: Awari is a Mancala game played on a 2×6 board with counters. The objective is to capture as many counters as possible by sowing them into the opponent's row.
dcterms:title: Awari

dcterms:creator: A. Kishimoto
M. H. M. Winands
M. Müller
J.-T. Saito
dcterms:description: MiniShogi is a variant of Shogi played on a 5×5 board with fewer pieces. The goal is to capture the opponent's King, and pieces can be promoted.
dcterms:title: MiniShogi

dcterms:creator: L. V. Allis
H. J. van den Herik
M. P. H. Huntjens
dcterms:description: Gomoku is a connection game played on a 15×15 board where players aim to align exactly five stones of their color. The game ends when a player achieves this goal.
dcterms:title: Gomoku

dcterms:creator: K. Handscomb
dcterms:description: Knightthrough is a variant of Breakthrough played on an 8×8 board where each player has 16 pieces that move like knights in chess. The goal is to reach the opponent's edge of the board.
dcterms:title: Knightthrough
